channel.title: [TuT] PHP Includes **for newbies
channel.description:
If you have ever been sick of having many different files on your website with a lot of the same information, this is your fix.
[b]Step 1:[/b]
Create a new file, and paste all of the information/code that is the same for some of your site's pages into it. Then save it as, "samestuff.inc"
So... if all of your pages looks close to this, but with different information:
[code]<html> <head> <title>Title</title> </head> <body> blahblah </body> </html>[/code]
you would take out the whole top bit, so "samestuff.inc" should look like this:
[code]<html> <head> <title>Title</title> </head> <body>[/code]
Keep in mind that if you want to put in the code at top, as well as the code at the bottom, you will need two different include files.
[b]Step 2:[/b]
On the pages that you want to include that information/code, input this code:
[code]<?php include('samestuff.inc') ?>[/code]
Now, what once looked like this:
[code]<html> <head> <title>Title</title> </head> <body> blahblah </body> </html>[/code]
Now looks like this:
[code]<?php include('samestuff.inc') ?> blahblah </body> </html>[/code]
Although from that example, it doesn't look like it would be a big help but on a lot of sites, it is. For instance, if you use it for links, you can easily change a link on all of your pages by only editing one file.
I hope this helps someone. If you have any questions, feel free to ask.
-Alexia

item.title: [TuT] PHP Includes **for newbies
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:29, topic:56014”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=79514.msg3188536#msg3188536 date=1272006010]

[quote author=N00b1 link=topic=79514.msg3187035#msg3187035 date=1271867931]

Already checked that too, no harm can be done with bumping up an old tutorial.

hahahahahahaha apart from giving me a laugh on what a fool i once was xD
[/quote]You were making a game with PHP?
[/quote]Is there something wrong with that?
[/quote]Just figured the world was passed text-based games.
[/quote]um websites can have graphics, no?
[/quote]With a server based programming language, the best you can do with the graphics is have predetermined gif images play, which will still depend on your text-decision, as it’s infeasible to make it dynamic, yet not impossible… You’d just need a LOOOOT of page refreshes.[/quote]
oh i was thinking more along the lines of ajax, and considered graphics as images not real-time 3d movement etc. graphics can be generated on-the-fly using php though.

Read full topic

item.title: [TuT] PHP Includes **for newbies
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

include isn’t a function, it’s a statement so it shouldn’t be used like a function.

<?php include("file.php"); //this is bad ?>

<?php include "file.php" ; //this is good ?>

Read full topic
